dt: {bc}a fissile rock that is formed by the consolidation of clay, mud, or silt, has a finely stratified or laminated structure, and is composed of minerals essentially unaltered since deposition

et: probably from obsolete or dialect {it}shale{/it} scale, shell, from Middle English, from Old English {it}scealu{/it} {ma}{mat|shell|}{/ma}
shortdef: a fissile rock that is formed by the consolidation of clay, mud, or silt, has a finely stratified or laminated structure, and is composed of minerals essentially unaltered since deposition

dt: {bc}a crude dark oil obtained from oil shale by heating

shortdef: a crude dark oil obtained from oil shale by heating

dt: {bc}a rock (such as shale) from which oil can be recovered by distillation

shortdef: a rock (such as shale) from which oil can be recovered by distillation
